thread.title: Corsearch Welcomes Two New Industry Experts to Its Expanding Team

author: cnbc.com
title: Corsearch Welcomes Two New Industry Experts to Its Expanding Team
text:
NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Corsearch, a trademark and domain solutions leader, is pleased to announce that Kathy Van der Herten has joined its Product Management team, reporting to Chief Technology Officer Guy Coene, and Tiffany Valeriano has joined the company as Director of Product Marketing, reporting to Chief Marketing and Strategy Officer Brett Amdur.
“We’re thrilled to welcome Kathy and Tiffany,” said Corsearch President and CEO Tobi Hartmann. “Corsearch is committed to continuously growing our team of the industry’s top experts. Attracting professionals with years of trademark experience is crucial to the high quality personal attention and expertise in execution we promise our clients. The fact that skilled professionals like Kathy and Tiffany have decided to join our team is a reflection of all the exciting, significant things happening at Corsearch.”
Kathy Van der Herten joins Corsearch after 21 years at industry competitor, Compumark, where she began her career as a Search Analyst. Later, her work with data scientists contributed to search algorithm improvement. Van der Herten then moved to the Product Management team, expanding her responsibilities to include, market insight assessment and product creation. Van der Herten ultimately led the Global Product Management Department and became a member of the Executive Team.
Van der Herten holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing from the Karel de Grote college in Antwerp, Belgium, and certification in Human-Centered Design from Catholic University of Leuven, Belgium. At Corsearch, Van der Herten will apply her industry expertise to help the Product Management team develop offerings that best meet the needs of the evolving trademark industry, as well as lead the UX Team in Mechelen, Belgium.
A former executive at TrademarkNow and Brandstock, Tiffany Valeriano’s expertise is in both service and technology. Valeriano’s background includes significant experience in coordinating large-scale IP projects worldwide and has been involved in creating some of the first online platforms for IP recordal projects in the industry.
Valeriano serves on the INTA Impact Studies Committee and is the Project Team Lead on a study INTA will be conducting on the impact of Artificial Intelligence on trademark practice. She holds a B.A. in Politics from the University of Virginia and is pursuing an E.M.B.A. from the Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University. In her new role at Corsearch, Valeriano will be responsible for assuring the success of the Corsearch go-to-market efforts associated with the company’s suite of product offerings.
About Corsearch
Corsearch is a premier provider of clearance and protection solutions for trademark and brand professionals. Its high-quality, intuitive tools and unparalleled expertise enable professionals to effectively manage their trademark screening, search review, watching, and domain management processes. With highly trained researchers, an expansive global content set and customer-focused technology tools available through the Corsearch platform, Corsearch empowers its customers with powerful brand solutions in an increasingly complex business environment.
For more information visit Corsearch.com , or contact Brett Amdur, Chief Marketing and Strategy Officer at 800-732-7241.
